Class DefaultVariant

  org.magelan.drawing.DefaultDrawingModel

java.io.Serializable, CoreModel, Derivate, Variant, DrawingModel
public class DefaultVariant
extends DefaultCoreModel
implements Variant, Derivate

A default implementation of drawing variant.

getDiffs

public java.util.List getDiffs(CoreModel parent)
Description copied from interface: Variant
Returns a list of differences between the variant and the parent CoreModel. The returned entities can be new, modified or deleted. Therefore the list may contain entities from both drawings.

Specified by:
getDiffs in interface Variant
Parameters:
parent - parent CoreModel to get diffs from
Returns:
a list of differences

getDecorateDiffs

public boolean getDecorateDiffs()
Determines whether differences should be painted with additional decoration.

Returns:
true if differences will be decorated

setDecorateDiffs

public void setDecorateDiffs(boolean decorateDiffs)
When this property is set differences will be painted with additional decoration. Decoration colors can be specified using the following properties: Variant.KEY_COLOR_NEW, Variant.KEY_COLOR_MODIFIED, Variant.KEY_COLOR_DELETED, Variant.KEY_COLOR_UNMODIFIED.

See Also:

add

public void add(java.lang.Object element)
Description copied from class: DefaultCoreModel
Adds an entity to the drawing. Note that:

  • if the entity has no layer set it is added to the current layer;
  • if entity's layer is not defined in the drawing, a default layer with the same name is added to it;
  • entity's color, linestyle and thickness may also be changed depending on the current color, linestyle and thickness of the CoreModel.

The method will fire a PropertyChangeEvent named DrawingModel.EVENT_ADD with the entity set as the new property value.

Specified by:
add in interface DrawingModel
Overrides:
add in class DefaultCoreModel
Parameters:
element - the element to add
See Also:
DefaultCoreModel.add(java.lang.Object)

removeFeature

public void removeFeature(java.lang.Object feature)
Description copied from class: DefaultCoreModel
Removes a feature from the drawing. The following rules will apply:

  • Layers - the layer named "0" cannot be removed and will always be present. If there are entities in the layer to remove, they will also be removed from the drawing;
  • LineStyles - the linestyle named "Default" cannot be removed;
  • TextStyles - the textstyle named "Default" cannot be removed;

See DrawingModel#removeFeature(Object) for details.

Specified by:
removeFeature in interface DrawingModel
Overrides:
removeFeature in class DefaultCoreModel
Parameters:
feature - the feature to remove
See Also:
DefaultCoreModel.removeFeature(java.lang.Object)

setCurrent

public void setCurrent(java.lang.Object feature)
Description copied from interface: DrawingModel
Sets a feature as current.

Fires DrawingModel.EVENT_FEATURE_CURRENT PropertyChangeEvent with the new and old current features stored in the event.

Specified by:
setCurrent in interface DrawingModel
Overrides:
setCurrent in class DefaultDrawingModel
Parameters:
